intro: Palicourea ceratantha, commonly known as the purple beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking purple to violet berries that appear in clusters, making it visually distinctive. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are shrubs or small trees. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered, and usually white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
